Issues.Title: Attempt to investigate DGV flaky tests.
Issues.Body:
Attempt to investigate DGV flaky tests. https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6926 https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6739

Both tests fail due to extra invalidate. To investigate further we need to understand 2 things:
- Couse of invalidate - call stack.
- Input parameters pattern (if any).

Issues.Title: Disable nuget warning NU 1505 until https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/24747 is fixed.
Issues.Body:
Error window in Visual Studio displays the following

```
Warning	NU1505	Duplicate 'PackageDownload' items found. Remove the duplicate items or use the Update functionality to ensure a consistent restore behavior. The duplicate 'PackageDownload' items are: 

Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x64 [7.0.0-preview.4.22214.7], 
Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x64 [7.0.0-preview.4.22214.7],
Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x64 [7.0.0-preview.4.22214.7],
Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x64 [7.0.0-preview.4.22214.7].

AccessibilityTests	D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\tests\AccessibilityTests\AccessibilityTests.csproj
```

The warning is supposed to report downloads of the same package with different versions - https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/reference/errors-and-warnings/nu1505

###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7024)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Disable nuget warning NU 1505 until https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/24747 is fixed." (#7024)

Issues.Title: revert https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7024 when the NUGET warning is fixed
Issues.Body:
Revert  https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7024  when https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/issues/24747 is fixed.

### Issue description

NU1505 was disabled because it was causing the following output in the VS:
```
Warning	NU1505	Duplicate 'PackageDownload' items found. Remove the duplicate items or use the Update functionality to ensure a consistent restore behavior. The duplicate 'PackageDownload' items are: 

Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x64 [7.0.0-preview.4.22214.7], 
Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x64 [7.0.0-preview.4.22214.7],
Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x64 [7.0.0-preview.4.22214.7],
Microsoft.NETCore.App.Host.win-x64 [7.0.0-preview.4.22214.7].

AccessibilityTests	D:\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms\tests\AccessibilityTests\AccessibilityTests.csproj
```

This warning was temporarily disabled in https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7024, and should be re-enabled when the but is fixed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "revert https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/7024 when the NUGET warning is fixed" (#7025)

Issues.Title: ListViewItem Collection Editor : The Text of item is not searched and the resource is not added to Form.resx for Localization.
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Visual Studio: 17.1.2

### .NET version

ALL

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

NO

### Issue description

So, if I want to solve it, I can only manage multiple languages by dynamically creating code. This is not a friendly way and I think it needs to be improved.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23723575/163516514-a28802a2-66d5-4832-be07-30a444c1991b.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23723575/163516368-c0e67c4f-4c7d-46be-af04-7f42dba33eba.png)


### Steps to reproduce

Create one.

### Diagnostics

```text
Nothing
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "ListViewItem Collection Editor : The Text of item is not searched and the resource is not added to Form.resx for Localization." (#7020)

Issues.Title: Multi-language setting invalid bug
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Visual Studio version: 17.1.2


### .NET version

ALL

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

No

### Issue description


![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/23723575/163394273-cfb3e519-d5d5-409a-a00d-e3a74b55e5b8.png)

My local region is `zh-CN`. So at runtime, the corresponding resources should be automatically recognized after the multi-language setting. But the runtime is English content. In this regard, I traced the code and found that the patch  `resourceCulture =  CultureInfo.CurrentCulture`(**Not a good solution**) can be specified in Strings resources. But for the **Form.resx**, I can't do anything about it. I think there is a serious flaw, if not well explained.


### Steps to reproduce

Nothing

### Diagnostics

```text
Nothing
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Multi-language setting invalid bug" (#7017)

Issues.Title: `RuntimeInformation.ProcessArchitecture` returns X64 architecture for Arm64 tests
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

7.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

Tests are run for x86, x64 and arm64 architectures. Some tests could be flaky on a specific architecture, so we introduced an attribute to skip a test when run on a certain architecture (https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/6599). The attribute uses the `System.Runtime.InteropServices.RuntimeInformation.ProcessArchitecture` property to determine the architecture. However, this property returns `Architecture.X64` for arm64 tests, which makes skipping tests for arm64 not working as expected.

For example, while `DataGridViewTests.DataGridView_ColumnHeadersHeight_SetWithHandle_GetReturnsExpected` has following attribute:
```
[ConditionalWinFormsTheory(UnsupportedArchitecture = Architecture.Arm64,
    Skip = "Flaky tests, see: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6597")]
```
it is still executed on arm64:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/102954094/163205970-c8476ec9-21cf-4dc9-84e4-10c421321fca.png)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Add Arm64 as an unsupported architecture on a unit test.
2. Search for the test in CI pipeline test results.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "`RuntimeInformation.ProcessArchitecture` returns X64 architecture for Arm64 tests" (#7013)

Issues.Title: Question: Windows Forms Designer default font
Issues.Body:
### Environment

vs2022

### .NET version

net472 & net6.0-windows

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

n/a

### Issue description

I have Form classes that were designed under net472 which had a default font of `new Font(FontFamily.GenericSansSerif, 8.25f)`.

When compiling/running under net6 I call `Application.SetDefaultFont(new Font(FontFamily.GenericSansSerif, 8.25f))` at the beginning of my program.

If I set my project `TargetFramework` to net472, the windows forms editor works as expected.

If I set my project `TargetFramework` to `net6.0-windows`, the windows forms editor wants to change
`this.AutoScaleDimensions = new System.Drawing.SizeF(6F, 13F);` -> `this.AutoScaleDimensions = new System.Drawing.SizeF(7F, 15F);`
along with changing every control's `Location` and `Size` and adding lines to set `.Margin`.

Is there a way to configure the designer to make it aware that my application uses an alternative default font under net6 so it doesn't make tons of changes to existing files when they are edited?

### Steps to reproduce

see description

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Question: Windows Forms Designer default font" (#7007)
